Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Amanda P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my father, having previously stayed here with daughter. Very central so easy to get to and find. Nice Italian restaurant and many others in the same street (especially recommend Carne Argentina if you like steak).

Reviews.Title: “central location and very fluffy pillows!”
Reviews.Author: Jessck78 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very easy to find, a short stroll up from central station. Hotel and rooms could certainly do with a revamp, but beds were spotless and very comfortable. Location was perfect, very central, and despite this we had a quiet and peaceful nights sleep... our visit was mid week tho so cant advise about weekends! Handy there was lockers available to store bags if you have more exploring of the city to do after check out. Breakfast was very basic.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: John883
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights at 65 euros per night. My room was basic and small. I hated the fact that the curtain did not keep all the light out so I could not sleep very well and it annoyed me in the morning. Also, the breakfast menu was not very varied, but at least it was fresh and tasty. Smoking is not allowed in the room; however I found an ashtray when I got inside, so probably nobody will tell you a thing if you do smoke. On the plus side, my room was really clean and the staff were polite and helpful. The wifi connection was good but I heard some floors have a problem in their internet connection, so be sure to ask if you need it. There is also a computer at the reception for all to use. The hotel itself is at the heart of the city, opposite Dam Square, 10 minute walk from Amsterdam Centraal station, and 5 minute walk from the Red Light District. And there are many coffeshops + smartshops nearby for whomever interested! You can also access all the main tram lines from Dam Square to visit sights around the city! Overall, I highly recommend this hotel for those travelling on a budget, and want to visit Amsterdam either for its sights or for its other "perks".

Reviews.Title: “Memorable trip”
Reviews.Author: Bhaskar S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just near to dam square and is well connected by public transport. Hotel is very nice and the service to customer is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: Karen P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location. Very Basic hotel but clean, ideal if you just want to get your head down. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “4 Day break.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay, and found the staff very helpful, Our rooms where basic,but clean, we had a great time in Amsterdam and would use this Hotel again.Only thing I would say as a negative would be,the stairs up to the reception,and down to the resturant, are steep and my mother in law found this a bit difficult.(82yrs old)

Reviews.Title: “great location, everything else poor”
Reviews.Author: DANII P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The only great thing about this hotel is the location also the staff is very helpful. Cleanliness, room, poor. The shower was blocked. Please do not request breakfast in advance booking- terrible. not choice at all-ham, cheese and vegs, no fruit at all??? the room and floor were dusty. I would recommend only the location, can not believe that this is 3 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: willy5
Reviews.Content: I was surprised with other reviews, just like we stayed at a different hotel. The room is not so small but it was not clean at all. The floor is not clean and when there is no other places to put your luggage, you'll have to open them on the dirty floor. The bathroom is so small and uncomfortable to squeez yourself in/out of the shower cube passing a small space of the toilet bowl. A night table beside the bed is so old and dirty, don't look inside the drawer, it's disgusting. Pillow cases are so old or dirty I'm not sure but they are grey not white. Shower faucet didn't stay on it's hook, you have to hold it with 1 hand all the time. The soap dispenser in the shower didn't work either, even I complained, the next day it still didn't work, I have to use my own soap I brought along. Breafast was poor. I stayed at so many hotels of this rating, never before to find such a poor breakfast like here, only 1 type of meat. On one morning of our stay, they just ran out of meat, just bread, butter and jam. For the price I paid, I considered this very low value and will never stay here again or recommend anybody at all.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: damian q Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, very central, although the rooms were basic the hotel staff were very friendly and accomodating. Self service for breakfast but very nice. I will definitely be back as location overrides any negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied customer”
Reviews.Author: robert g Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A clean, budget hotel, that is in a central location. Rooms are tidy and the breakfast is good value. I would definately stay in this hotel, again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all the way”
Reviews.Author: 442jack
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is amongst the best in Amsterdam, between Dam Square and The Red Light District. 5 twin rooms booked. The rooms are a little tired but made up for with the excellent standard of cleanliness. The hotel is situated on a main street so there is an expected level of noise as there is some noise inside the hotel from the movement of fellow guests. The saff were amazing!! Nothing was too much trouble, they are both welcoming and accommodating, true professionals. We had breakfast included in the room rate. Very basic, bread, jams, cheese, eggs, hot drinks and juice, all very fresh and good quality and plentiful. We ate in the restaurant below the hotel and received first class food and service. As we were guests they also gave us a 10% discount. This hotel is the perfect place for friends wanting to explore and enjoy Amsterdam with everything on your doorstep at an affordable cost!!

Reviews.Title: “Spring in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Doowit Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it was conveniently situated for most things. Breakfast was very good and I liked the fact it was served until 10.45am, the staff were very friendly. The room was on the top floor and was a fair size with a nice powerful shower, we would have liked a hairdryer and a bit more hanging space in the wardrobe. The big downside was the noise from the street, it was so loud that our sleep was disturbed constantly right through the night.

Reviews.Title: “Springtime in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jules49 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is unbeatable just off Dam Square. The view is decent (room 204) of the lively street below. The single room is really tiny but clean enough and adequate for the purpose, Breakfast was fine. Would return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “hotel doria amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: david l Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a short midweek break my wife and i ,the location is excellant on a noisy street but you wouldnt think so inside the hotel the beds were clean and very comfy and the rooms are cleaned daily the staff are very pleasant and all in all highly recommended for the price .

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good value, brill location!”
Reviews.Author: Kristi I Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, couldnt ask for a better place to stay. Room was very clean and beds comfy, would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: Mona77
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location for sure, Dam square is just around the corner and that's lovely. By foot you can quickly go to the train station and you can easily explore the town from there. There are lots of buses near it. No need to say anything about the area: it's full of life, restaurants, pubs, shops and whatever. The hotel is simple and the location really basic. With basic I mean that in the room there were 1 bed, 1 small wardrobe, 1 small round table, 1 chair, tv and phone, nothing else at all. It was not a big room, but not even too small, the negative aspect was that there isn't any place to put your luggage and stuff, I had lots of my things on the floor. There wasn't even a night table. Private bathroom, it was clean. Wifi for free working fine. I was on the last floor and the lift was until the last but one, so I had to use stairs which is not the best when you are tired and/or with luggage. There are stairs also to go to the reception, something like 8 steps. You can use the safety box for free, just leaving a deposit, but it's at the reception and it's quite small. Breakfast was included and it's basic, too, you can count how many things they offer and it's no more than 10. You can eat as much as you want, but a little bit more variety would be welcome. You can pay only cash which isn't so useful, but it was clearly stated in the booking. It wasn't a bad stay at the end, but really, really, really basic.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced. very small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: varoojan13
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms. Didn't feel clean. Location good. Don't understand the overprice! breakfast ok.

Reviews.Title: “the whole package”
Reviews.Author: Brian R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay and would use this hotel again when staying in Amsterdam, rooms were clean and tidy although the bathroom was on the small side. Brilliant location just off dam square ten minutes from central train station,the breakfast was a bit basic but standard. The staff were friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great if the central location is the prime focus of your visit”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer W Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, just a few steps away from the centre. The hotel itself is very average, we had a room on the top floor which was out of the way and very quite. the beds were comfy enough and we had a toilet and shower to ourselves too. Breakfast was continental and lovely. There was an issue with our room keys on the first day which was a little inconvenient because I had to keep running up and down the stairs to ask the receptionist to re-boot our door swipe cards. However he was very helpful and most polite with the situation. The only concern I would have about this hotel is the house keeping staff, on our final evening, my friend had noticed that her things had been moved around after the cleaners had been in to change our beds. She had noticed that her face cream had gone missing - nothing major but enough to make you feel suspicious. If I was to visit Amsterdam again I probably would not stay in this hotel again but I would definatly recommend it to anyone who is looking for somewhere cheap and close to the centre. For this it is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Mareks D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Price for beds and location in Amsterdam is comparable. But I would suggest to owners take car more about small things - like torn curtains, 50 % of all lights in room are not working, remote control without batteries. For that price and 100 m form main Dam square it is good hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “jjkh”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely staff all very welcoming and provided and great service, Ideal location in the heart of amsterdam, room ok but no tea or coffee making facilities or Hair Dryer as like most modern fitted hotels, more suited to those on a short stay as there is nowhere to store items of an Un Packed suitcase, Overall Worth the Reccomendation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way.”
Reviews.Author: sha37
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend in Amsterdam.Stayed at Hotel Doria. Very central. Just off Dam Square.15 minute walk from the central railway station. It's a small hotel over an Italian restaurant. 10% off if you eat in the restaurant. Breakfast is included & is very substantial. Staff are extremely helpful. Our room was at the back of the hotel & the room was quite dark but for the time we stayed in the room it really didn't matter. The room was basic but spotlessly clean & the bed was very comfortable. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for me”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the second time i've been to the Doria now and as with the first time found the hotel superb for my needs.Small room yes but i was on my own and only needed a place to lay my head, it was clean and tidy, the staff helpful and it is situated in an ideal position for everything Amsterdam has to offer. My friend who i came to visit for the day says that it's a bargain compared to other places in the center of Amsterdam. Would i go back........YES!!!!

Reviews.Title: “many happy returns!”
Reviews.Author: DeanRochester_8
Reviews.Content: i've stayed at the doria several times,it's a great hotel in the centre of the action...lovely staff,warm room,good shower & a great breakfast...excellent value for money....a great base for exploring this fantastic city...

Reviews.Title: “Location?”
Reviews.Author: AlanGregory94 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Situated literally within yards of Dam Square, and easy walking distance of the nearby Coffee Shops and Sex Area this hotel is situated above a restaurant and of basic nature. The staff are very pleasant and the rooms clean. Only bad point is the smell from the restaurant downstairs which is noticeable in the hotel, but strangely not apparent when inside the rooms. Location on a budget best sums up the experience and I would stay here again because of its proximity to the action.

Reviews.Title: “ideal situation, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Kazongazonga
Reviews.Content: we were pleasently surprised with this litttle hotel. the staff were friendly, the rooms were small but very clean. we had an en suite bath, shower and toilet. there was a TV in the room with quite a few channels. the room was really warm and cosy which was great as it was freezing outside. we didnt have a great view, just an ally way, but that wasnt a problem as we were out most of the time anyway. there is a small lift to all the floors which is quite handy, but like i said it was very small, and a bit to intimate to share with randoms and we often took the stairs, and the stairs smelled like a hostel. if you know what i mean. it was great that it was also a restaurant too, as you could just nip downstairs for a snack, the food smells great! the breakfast wasn't bad for the included price, it includes 1 meat, chese, bread, tomatoes and cucumber, 2 cerials, oj, teas and coffee and yogurts. (as the hotel got busier towards the weekend, the yogurts ran out before we got to them. the situation of the hotel is also great, if you take a left out of the front door you are right in the red light district and if you take a right you are at Dam Square. this hotel was ideal for what we needed. we will go back!

Reviews.Title: “4 days stay over Christmas 2011”
Reviews.Author: KENSouthWalesUk
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel but very clean and comfortable. Staff excelent. Rooms small but hey, was only sleeping there. Great location 50 mts from Dam square. Everything you need and want to do on the doorstep. Definetly will return

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here- much better options”
Reviews.Author: coconut-monkey09
Reviews.Content: i wouldnt recomend this hotel to anybody other than a backpacker, although there are far better and cheaper hostels in town. I have visited amsterdam around thirty times and have stayed in a number of differnt central hotels. My room in the doria was very close to the worst. We had stayed at the single hotel the two previous nights and although it is basic the single is superiour in every way. We (me and my brother) stayed at the doria due to our flight being cancelled at 11pm at night. I got my girlfriend to book it online from the uk. Knowing amsterdam was busy i considered ourselfs to be very luck to get a hotel room and at 80euro it was much more appealing than sleaping at schipol. When we got to the hotel we discovered it was on damstraat (which is busy 24hrs and fairly noisy). At reception they could not find any record of booking, but offered us a twin room at 80e which was what we wanted. (they the next day did email my girlfriend to say they had found booking but wouldnt charge her-all good there). we got lift up to top floor where room was, alarm bells rang when in the corridor there was evidence of paint work (masking tape round fixtures and fittings) although it was a terrible job and no smell of paint- like it had been this way for quite a while. Anyhow you dont sleep in the corridors so not really to bothered. the room is a differnt matter and why i have given place such a poor rating. I didnt expect much, and got even less. The walls were covered in stains, dirty marks, general filth- if they had been painted or cleaned in past 15years i would be stunned. Window plane was missing and a patch work card and tape job had been done- due to this it was not warm. Curtains had suspect white stain and had a letter "j" marked on them in tomato sauce (i almost wet myself laughing at that and got a pic or two of it). Floor was filthy, didny even want to touch bed side table etc as it was disgusting. Beds had seen better days about a decade ago, and given the general state of room i decided to sleep fully clothed on top of it. Bathroom was acually ok, and looked clean. Me and my brother did expect much given time/price/location however we both found the place to be so bad that it was funny. Kind of made me think of the kind of seedy hotel that rented rooms by the hour rather than night although it isnt. At time i felt lucky to get room but in hindsite i wish we had slept at airport. I am trully stunned at positive reviews of this hotel. If you have any questions or need any advice about amsterdam in general feel free to message me.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: kmc14
Reviews.Content: We have been to Amsterdam before and stayed further out than Dam square in some very nice hotels, which just meant getting trams backwards and forwards, we were a little worried that Doria would not meet our expectations of a good hotel, but on arrival we were greeted by a lovely member fo staff who made us very welcome, our rooms were a little small but very clean, shower and bathroom very clean too, we were on 4th floor so quiet not much street noise. staff at hotel were fab really nice and breakfast was served down stairs in the pizza resturant we found it to be fine, got us of to a start. Location was great though so central to everything, you come out of hotel right on to Dam square, 10 min walk to rembrant and 5 mins or less to red light, we couldnt have been in better location, Amsterdam is very expensive though so becareful when going into bars prices for a pint range from between 4-7.50 euros a pint. you can eat out cheap if you shop around and there are plenty of takeaway places,

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: chilldog
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here on the 15th and 16th Nov 2011. Staff were great. Room was kind of small with three single beds but we were only in the room to sleep. Very clean and room got cleaned every day. Great shower. Clean towels every day. Breakfast was in the deal and was okay, not much on offer but you wouldn't starve. The bread is lovely. I would stay again. Great location, short walk from the station. We was on the third floor which is getting decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Different to what I was expecting!”
Reviews.Author: Happy_kitteh
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel I was a little worried, it didn't look very big from the outside and I thought we'd end up in a hostel type shared room a one bathroom per floor kind of deal. However I was extremely pleased to be proven wrong. It had a feel of Faulty Towers but that was due to the lay out. The rooms were extremely clean, like absolutely spotless, and the staff were so friendly, they even had a hair dryer when I needed one. I had a little trouble with the shower as the cold tap was rather stiff, but apart from that, nothing wrong with my stay. We also got a Continental Breakfast the next day, which was really nice, they have little packets of chocolate dip or peanut butter. Lovely stuff. The pizza place underneath the hotel is also worth a visit. Would definitely stay there again as the location is absolutely spot on, you are in the centre of everything, and the staff could not do nay more for us.

Reviews.Title: “our experience at the doria”
Reviews.Author: berenice l
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience. Rooms are small but to be expected in Amsterdam.. They were clean and comfortable. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The food at the Restaurant was plentiful and very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, good prices. Basic stay.”
Reviews.Author: teudatole
Reviews.Content: My third time in this hotel. Central location, friendly stuff... Only one hairdrier in reception. The rooms that are facing Damstraat are very noisy. No air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good location”
Reviews.Author: eyes66
Reviews.Content: Room small but clean and ok for what we wanted, a clean bed to sleep in at the end of the day. Ideal location for everything that's going on. Had noisy 'neighbours' but besides that, got a good nights sleep, although the rooms are very warm! Breakfast basic, but enough. You can get a Full English across the road if not enough. Would go back

Reviews.Title: “never again! can do much better!”
Reviews.Author: marina4885
Reviews.Content: we paid 80 euros per night, and i believe could have done much better with the huge selection in the town center. tiny rooms, not very clean, can bearly fit 2 people. hot and very very noisy, even late at night (it is, after all, the red window district). breakfast was poor and unsatisfying. over-priced for such poor conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for exploring the city, basic b&b”
Reviews.Author: Adeola80
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positives: there is no better location if you intend to explore the city. It is just next to the Dam Square, 2 minutes walk from the Red-light district and 10 minutes walk from the Central Station. This is a very basic 3 star hotel (bed and breakfast), and if you intend to spend the whole day in the city, and just come back to the hotel to sleep at night, Doria Hotel is perfect. It is relatively cheap, the staff were very welcoming and helpful with their recommendations, and there is a nice Italian restaurant in the building (although you have the whole Damstraat with places to eat, the choices are endless). Most of the guests were young couples and groups of friends, and also on the street around the hotel there was an atmosphere of "the party goes on"... We liked it very much... The room was relatively spacious and they cleaned it every day... Now the less positive: if you want a central location, there is a price to that: the street is very busy till the latest night hours, so if you want to get some sleep, the windows must be kept closed. Also a hairdryer would be a nice addition. The room itself was clean, but the curtains really need some laundry... In the bottom line, you can not expect too much from a 3 stars b&b, and I think it was good value for money. I would recommended it more to young couples and friends...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: JenCos
Reviews.Content: Doria Hotel was smack bang at the centre of it all with an excellent location just off Dam Square. It is within walking distance of most tourist spots and saves a small fortune on trams and the like if you decide to walk. The hotel itself has it's own pizzeria beneath it with a varied menu which is very handy if you do not want to venture far for lunch/dinner. Breakfast is also served in the same restaurant in the mornings. I must admit that it is very expensive to opt for breakfast but it is that way everywhere you look, especially considering it is very basic - cereals/toast/coffee/tea/juice/. I found it very handy however and it avoided my having to go round every morning looking for other equally expensive breakfasts. The hotel per se was clean; both the common areas and the room itself. The hotel is served with a lift which is handy considering the exceptionally steep and small steps Amsterdam has. The reception is manned by multi-lingual staff 24 hours a day who are always ready to help out and speak a multitude of languages. I only had one dodgy receptionist in my whole week there. Moving on to the hotel room. I had a single room, which was absolutely tiny. There is no other way to describe it but tiny. If you open out your hands, you can touch both walls on either side of its width. The bed was also on the small side, in the corner of the room and not on the comfortable side. The room also contained a small wardrobe but one would have to leave the luggage in the middle of the room if it is quite a sizeable luggage. That meant that I had to lift the luggage on to the bed to get to the other side of the room. The only complaint apart from size is that like all other buildings in Amsterdam, the walls seem to be paper thin, and you can hear nearby rooms' doors slam during the night. I only had one problem with the noise in the evening from a demonstration taking place at Dam Square all night but that cannot be remedied by the hotel management. The room had its own bathroom. Small but very practical. I had a problem with the sink as it was leaking and flooding the bathroom every time I opened the tap. I phoned reception to send someone to fix it which they did a couple of hours later. When that didn't solve the problem, they offered to change my room or change the base of the sink (which they did). All in all, despite the tiny and very bland looking room (it reminded me of a prison cell and I had a room overlooking a wall), I would stay at the Dora Hotel again and recommend it. Location trumps all other factors as it is at the centre of it all, unless you are after dÃ©cor and the luxuries.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel at a great location. Not for the disabled though.”
Reviews.Author: pilot1200
Reviews.Content: The Location ------------------------ Hotel Doria is placed at Damstraat 3, right next to Dam square. It's about 10 min walk from the central station (walking along the Damrak avenue), and right next to the red light district. There's a tram station 50-80m away from the hotel, and another one just past the royal palace (which is located at Dam square). As the street (Damstraat) is just next to the red light distreect, and is hosts many restaurants and snack places, it is full of people at the evenings (and nights), probably people visiting the red light district, or just looking for a night snack. The hotel surroundings are very lively at night, and if you like it, you'll enjoy this hotel, being close to all that. If, however, you like a quiet night, hotel Doria isn't the hotel for you. The hotel ------------------------ Hotel Doria is a very basic hotel. Some might even say, it is more a two star hotel rather than three. The rooms are very small. The one we stayed at (room #110, pictures attached) was about 3m X 4m, *including* the bathroom (I'm attaching pictures so you can see for yourselves). There are two single beds (which can be joined together), but only 30-40cm spare to the sides of the beds. One side has a wooden rack you can place your keys/cellphone on. The other side have nothing near the bed, so you can't even put your glasses near the bed (only one can). There is a tiny wooden cabinet (something like 50cm by 50cm, 140cm tall), and a very small desk. The only place you can open your luggage is near the door (or on the beds, but then when you want to use the bed, you'll have to close and store it near the door). The bathroom features a shower and a toilet, it's quite clean and towels are changed daily. There's a dispencer filled with soap at the shower, and another one near the sink. The bathroom is very small, and it is not comfortable to use the toilet, or to change in. There is no mini bar, nor an air condition (I wouldn't stay there during the summer when it's hot), or a safe deposit box. There's a small 12inch TV, an alarm clock back from the Eighties, and a desk fan, all are connected to the single power outlet in the room, via a 4-way power outlet splitter. This is not the most comfortable room to stay at. Very claustrophobic. There is a soda vending machine near the reception, as well as a shared microwave oven, a fridge, and a desktop computer connected to the internet for everyone to use. Safes are also avilable near the reception (it isn't at a locked room, rather in the 'looby'). There are also some electric kettles and a pressing iron which I guess that guests can borrow and use. The staff is very nice and helpful. The receptionists always tried to help and they all talk good English. The breakfast is very basic. It well get your day started, but the selection isn't too exciting. It is important to mention, that this hotel is not accessible for disabled or limited people. Reaching the ground floor of the hotel requires climbing 8 stairs, and accessing the restaurant (for breakfast) requires further stairs climbing. The hotel elevator reaches the 4th floor, however there are five floors, and the fifth floor is only reachable... via the stairs. So if you're somewhat limited with mobility, this hotel might not be the one for you. Summary ------------------------ Hotel Doria is a very basic hotel, at a premium location. It does not fit people with disability or mobility limitation, as it requires being able to climb up and down the stairs. Its facilities are poor, and the rooms (surely the one we were at) are tiny and claustrophobic. However, it is priced accordingly, and it is right at the center of Amsterdam, so its value-for-money ratio is great. Just don't build your expectations too high.

Reviews.Title: “best location ever!”
Reviews.Author: UkLisag
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 2 friends and the location couldnt of been better! Isnt the best hotel ive stayed in, but it was perfect for us as all we needed was a crash pad! Very friendly staff and we were able to check in a few hours early. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “we shall find something better”
Reviews.Author: hcrespin
Reviews.Content: the room was small and noisy without ac.the service and the breakfast were ok, the hotel is in the center of the city,near Dam square -very good transportation near the central train station but very crowdy and very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Abdulrahman81
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in this hotel 2 times winter 2010 and 2011 , the location is perfect , near main road where all the attractions and night life .. staff were very nice helpfull and the place was very clean ... room was very clean and bed was comfy .. heater worked perfectly i always look closely to my bed sheets and bathroom as im a very picky person and i found this place very clean ...if you like the pice ...dont think twice ..ill be very happy if anyone have Questions

Reviews.Title: “Best location in low level hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bob293984
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated more than centrally. Nevertheless, all modestly: room service, catering. Sleep is not,cosily.Bathroom only shower cell.Water tap difficult to configure. The rooms are very narrow. At night, stifling.At the same time the ceilings are very high in the rooms. A couple - three nights, you can suffer.Because is the best location in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Average But Restaurant is Quite Poor”
Reviews.Author: Steinhur23
Reviews.Content: In my leisure trip to Amsterdam, I have stayed in this hotel. the room was tiny, the price was a bit high. But satisfy my expectation for Amsterdam. However the restaurant is really poor in terms of service. The rude treatment. For dinner, they have showed us a place and after our order, they have decided that we do not deserve to sit on that table. They forced to change our table. Not recommending at all the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, central budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vdubmad
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days and would definately stay again. We paid Â£45 a night pp Inc breakfast which is brilliant for a central city centre hotel. The rooms were spotless, clean towels and fully cleaned every day. Bathroom was spotless if small, room had adequate room and flatscreen TV. Room over looked Damstraat but the double glazing blocked out the noise very well. 10% discount from the pizzeria downstairs and the fabulous Louis Bar is just over the road. Brilliant location, friendly staff and luggage storage. Hotel also has a lift.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: tahlz22
Reviews.Content: the hotel was certainly not flash, but location made up for anything else that may have lacked. would deffinatley stay there again, simply based on location. the staff were very helpful & friendly

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping in a young offenders cell”
Reviews.Author: funkeeslave
Reviews.Content: Tiny, tiny room for three people. Think I have become clautraphobic after it . Sheets and towels were clean and changed saily but walls needed painted and I have never been in as small a bathroom in my life. Brill location thou

Reviews.Title: “it does have 3* rooms but they put us in rooms that looked like prison cells”
Reviews.Author: bambiN
Reviews.Content: The hotel was right in the middle of amsterdam which was perfect, although it was pretty dodgy looking from the outside. The reception staff were great, very friendly and helpful. After climbing 3000 stairs, like everywhere else in amsterdam, we opened the door to our room.......PRISON. The walls were really grubby and the previous guests, dating back years im sure had left 'Zoe wuz ere' etc on the walls in ink. However, it didn't smell, the bathroom was small yet clean, the sheets were clean, the towels were changed everyday. when we got up on the second day there was a double room opposite ours being cleaned so we peeped in to see if it was the same as ours and it looked like the ritz, lovely white walls and nice big bed! they must have ran out of money when it came to the other rooms. Breakfast was toast, cucmbers and that sort of thing so we left starving. The best thing about this hotel was the location, we were beside everything and didnt have to waste time in trams etc. I would probably stay here again because it was cheap, central and quiet and we were only there to sleep. if you want luxury do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Not a three stars hotel, soones two. Poor car service.”
Reviews.Author: arkadiyl20
Reviews.Content: Good location Satisfied lunch. Not refrigerator and air condition in the room. Car servise, which they recomend to mee, used my car, eated sweets remained in the car and damage the monitor of car back camera. I detect that after departore from Hotel and can't clame anybody. Made the car dirty inside.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central, great service, quiet”
Reviews.Author: TomKolan
Reviews.Content: When booking a 3 stars hotel right at the jeart of the city, one must not expact enormous rooms and large loby. That said - we realy enjoyed hotel Doria. Rooms were very clean, sheets and towels replaced each day. Bad was comfortable. The shower and toilet - clean, good water flow. The staff was very very very warm - especially Ruben, which we can't thank him enough for the useful tips and help. Free wireless internet, inside rooms. The location - well, enough said about that. Breakfast - everything you need. In short, great value for money for a few days stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, warm staff....very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Aps_12
Reviews.Content: I had booked my accomodation at this hotel thru www.easytobook.com in May 09. My total experience was simply hassel free. Though I found the room too small for 2 yet I guess place is a scarcity there. The solitary tiny window in the room was too high to be operated by a person of normal height. The room initially looked like a dungeon to me coverted into a room, but considering I was spending only the nights to sleep, these basic negatives did not weigh too heavy to spoil my fun of holidays. The staff was really very very helpful, well versed in customer handling and also assisting me in my local trip bookings and tracing my lost baggage at schipool airport. 200% kudos to their warm and helpful attitude, which actually makes your stay real value for money in this tiny hotel situated at the heart of Amesterdam, quiet literally. Madam Tussad was bang opposite and the central railway station was just a walk away

Reviews.Title: “Not a three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: muzzy7771
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for three nights. The reception is on the first floor above a restaurant and is quite small and pokey. It clearly has not had much money spent on it and has the feel of a budget two star hotel. I had a single bedroom which was tiny and the en suite shower room was equally small. The common parts of the hotel has a smell of food which probably comes from the restaurant below. The location however is its selling point, with excellent access to the city centre amenities.

Reviews.Title: “awsome place to stay, so friendly and helpfull, and right in the middle of town, wicked”
Reviews.Author: paddyf1
Reviews.Content: Subject: Doria Hotel Amsterdam Location: Amsterdam, Noord-Holland, The Netherlands, Europe Title: awsome place to stay, so friendly and helpfull, and right in the middle of town, wicked ID#: 48117555 this hotel is first class if your goin to amsterdam, based in the heart of amsterdam, me n my wife like to visit the coffee shops and if you do likewise this is the hotel for you, coffee shop outside opposite top place, , the staff cant do enough for ya its heaven, plus u get a nice continental breky with somethink to cater for all tastes, we ad a double bed so cozy! , , ur ontop of the action, everythink is in walking distance whether it be art galleries, canal boat rides, i nice pub or better still coffee shops for a real feel to amsterdam, anne frank museum is close to, so enjoy ur days out n then back to the doria for a wonderfull nites kip, n just because its central dont think its to noisy when trying to kip as we never heard much at all once ur window was closed, tip dont look at the price in english pounds as u will b disapointed when u arive n the exchange rate u got does not resemble what u pay in euros, so basically just look at the price in euros and u want go rong, ignore the price in pounds when booking any hotel outside of uk. enjoy ur stay , wish we were back there now!!! ps thank you to all at the doria for all the help use provided.

Reviews.Title: “ideally situated.”
Reviews.Author: warrior5499
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 days and we havent got one complaint, the room was clean with ensuite, staff were helpful so no complaints. After reading some of the reviews we were a bit apprehensive but when we arrived it was spot on.

Reviews.Title: “great location, not clean enough”
Reviews.Author: vaykaygal
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Doria, it was our 3rd visit to A'dam. The location is great, but the room was not clean. The phone had a layer of dust on it, the comforter and blankets were not washed (obvious spots of dirt) and the sheets were stained. The sheets had been washed but they had stains reamining. I kept my sandals on while in the room because I did not feel comfortable walking on the carpet in my bare feet. We were looking for a cheap hotel so the price fit the bill. The next time we visit the Dam we will be paying the extra 30 eur and staying at a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, all good.”
Reviews.Author: SteeveW
Reviews.Content: After reading some bad reviews of this hotel i was apprehensive about our stay prior to our arrival. The hotel is in an excellent location located just off Dam square round the corner from the Grand Hotel. As we arrived in Amsterdam mid morning we went to the hotel and left our bags, lockers available and reception manned 24 hours. Check in is 1pm. Staff very friendly & helpful. The rooms were small but this is to be expected for hotels in Amsterdam centre of this price range. Rooms were smoking, en-suite, clean, quiet and a lift available to all floors which was good. A basic breakfast was included in the down stairs italian restaurant. Check out is 11am. We stayed 3 nights at the hotel and were very happy with out stay and had no complaints. Would stay there again & recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Doria”
Reviews.Author: Sorayasky
Reviews.Content: Central location to shopping and very easy to find from the train station. Very friendly and helpful staff upon my arrival and during my stay, the room was pleasant and clean and had everything that i needed! The restaurant was good and was nice to sit in to get a late leisurely breakfast and watch the world go by! I will definitely stay here again and recommend my friends to this small quaint hotel.

Reviews.Title: “tiny, but nice and kosher”
Reviews.Author: drorJerusalem
Reviews.Content: they have kosher meals, and they are jewish-friendly in all the Shabbat details. Israeli-owned. Walking distance to the portugese synagogue.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Britchip
Reviews.Content: After disappointing with Shelter Jordan because of cleanliness, I started looking for another hotel in that evening. Unfortunately, every hotel was full except Doria. I did not want to pay and check in unless I saw the room. Finally, the lady in the reception gave me a key see the available room. I tried to open the door but I found a man was there so I knew this hotel was not safe for a woman. I came sownstair and asked for another key. This time I saw the room..I had to pay for 80 euro for a single room ... dirty and unsafe. Therefore I decided to return the key and not to stay there... lucky me.. I thought if I had to pay 80 euro for that kind of room, I 'd rather go back to shelter jordan and stay there.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: DeanRochester_8
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the doria many times now and really can't complain.You only pay Â£40 a night for a single room and your right in the city centre.All the staff were fine and if your in Dam then you really should't be spending that much time in your hotel anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Would try something else next time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights the end of March 2006, was booked in advance. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Room and bathrooom are absolutely tiny. Everthing is dingy, older, smoke smell every where. Stayed on the second floor. Despite double windows the noise from the street is audible till 4 AM. The advertising photos do no justice to reality. Location was great, but for 80 Euro/night there has to be something better.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I and three friends stayed at this excellently located hotel, we were greeted by a friendly receptionist named Robin who showed us our rooms. The rooms were tiny and impossible to move around in, if you ever walked two steps you either bump into a bed, a wall, or at other times, forced into the bathroom, which itself was only the walk in type. The lice under the bed were most uncomfortable and the scratching from the walls at night was frightening. The blankets are throwovers, the unwashable type which cusomer after customer shares, this was obvious from the smell, which is why i slept using my jacket as a blanket. This hotel includes a breakfast, so I was shocked to see that the 'breakfast' consisted of a slice of toast, apple juice and a boiled egg, it was then I knew we had been stitched up. The staff, especially the night receptionist and head waiter were ruder than I could have imagined, throwing the food bills and plates of food on our table, insulting customers in their private language. That said, the manager was most apologetic and as a condolence, he offered us a 'Doria hotel' shirt to which we duly refused. If you are not into filthy and small rooms, with rude staff, then avoid this place at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but horrible room”
Reviews.Author: TheCoopersYWG
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel from the airport for 80 euros a night, location was great, located at the 'dam' and the restaurant beneath it is good. The room was terrible, you had to literally shimmy around the bed to get around the room, and the bathroom was about 3 ft sq at the most. The bed was uncomfortable and the paint was peeling off the walls, We cancelled our second night, and there were no problems, they even offered to store our bags in the lockers on site until we were done out tour. Staff was excellent though. I would not recommed this hotel, there are much nicer options in amsterdam for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Dont book a single room at the front.”
Reviews.Author: geoffboxer
Reviews.Content: Very fine location. The restaurant below is good also. The single room I was offered was on the top floor and had only a skylight for a window. It was very small and the toilet almost impossible to get into. The room was a bit grubby and dull. I had booked in advance and told the receptionist I was not satisfied. She told me I could be moved to a better room tomorrow, so I stayed. My case was taken for me to a better room by staff and this room reflected the price paid. OK for the traveller on a tight budget, but thats all.

HotelInfo.Name: Doria Hotel Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Damstraat 3, Amsterdam 1012 JL, The Netherlands
